## Introduction

Signs of recent low recruitment for several species in the grouper-snapper complex in the South Atlantic

![](images/TimeSeries/RecDev.png){fig-align="center" width="500" height="500"}

# Introduction

-   Low recruitment pattern on Winter spawners ![](images/TimeSeries/spawningseason.png){fig-align="center" width="800" height="600"}

## Methods

**CNAPS (4km resolution)** - SST - Bottom Temperature - SSH - Depth Mixed Layer - Initially considered in m, now as a fraction of local depth

-   Surface Salinity
    -   Considered initially but removed as it was the variable with the least correlation and patterns)
-   For future incorporation: Chrolophyll
    -   Merged Satellite Chrolophyll from Copernicus (SeaWiFS, MODIS, MERIS, VIIRS-SNPP & JPSS1, OLCI-S3A & S3B)
-   **Study area:**
    -   currently bounded at Cape Canaveral (\~28.5ºN) and Cape Hatteras (\~35ºN) from shore to the 700m isobath
-   **Time:**
    -   Monthly Averaged time series for 1993-2023
    -   Seasonally Averaged (Winter - JFM, Spring - AMJ, Summer - JAS, Fall - OND)
    -   Spawning Seasonal Averages - Winter: FMA, Summer: JJA
